intro: Pultenaea dentata, commonly known as the serrated pultenaea, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect shrub form. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have serrated margins, giving it its common name. Pultenaea dentata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
